SEARCH
Package org.jarzarr.scene

Class SceneManager

java.lang.Object
org.jarzarr.scene.SceneManager
public class SceneManager extends Object
Stack-based scene controller.

Supports:

  • set(Scene) — replace entire stack
  • push(Scene) — push overlay
  • pop() — pop top
  • replaceTop(Scene) — replace only the top scene

All mutations are deferred until safe points during update().

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneManager

      public SceneManager()

  • Method Details

    • set

      public void set(Scene scene)
      Replace everything with a new base scene (deferred).

    • push

      public void push(Scene scene)
      Push an overlay scene on top (deferred).

    • pop

      public void pop()
      Pop the top scene (deferred).

    • replaceTop

      public void replaceTop(Scene scene)
      Replace only the top scene (deferred). This is critical for transitions where you need to swap a wrapper scene into/out of the stack without destroying the base scene underneath.

    • top

      public Scene top()

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()

    • transitionTo

      public void transitionTo(Scene next, SceneTransition transition)
      Replace the entire stack with a transition wrapper that fades from the current top to next, then ends with next as the only scene. Use this for: title -> game, game -> gameover, level changes, etc.

    • transitionPush

      public void transitionPush(Scene overlay, SceneTransition transition)
      Push an overlay scene (pause/menu) with a transition. After the transition completes, the wrapper is replaced with the overlay (stack is preserved).

    • transitionPop

      public void transitionPop(SceneTransition transition)
      Pop the current top scene with a transition. This replaces the current top with a transition wrapper which fades back to the scene below, then pops the wrapper.

    • update

      public void update(double dt)
      Call once per update tick.

    • render

      public void render(Graphics2D g)
      Call once per render frame.

    • onResize

      public void onResize(int w, int h)
